metadata.Title: CVE-2021-44648 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
GNOME gdk-pixbuf 2.42.6 is vulnerable to a heap-buffer overflow vulnerability when decoding the lzw compressed stream of image data in GIF files with lzw minimum code size equals to 12.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-44648` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gdkpixbuf-2.0 - 2.40.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.4
libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0 - 2.40.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.4
libgdk-pixbuf2.0-bin - 2.40.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.4
libgdk-pixbuf2.0-common - 2.40.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gdk-pixbuf package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.40.0+dfsg-3ubuntu0.4').
